intro: Gymnocarpos algeriensis, commonly known as Algerian sandthorn, is a shrub native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Zygophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and spiny stems. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are usually covered with a fine layer of white hairs. Its fruit is a small, woody capsule that contains several seeds. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
